The series kicked off with India holding their nerve in a thriller at the Wankhede on Tuesday, edging Sri Lanka by two runs on a difficult wicket.
The last time before this series when these two teams met in T20s was in the Asia Cup, where Sri Lanka defeated India by six wickets.
Sri Lanka are coming off the Lanka Premier League with several players having impressive campaigns.
India go into the second game with a 1-0 lead.
The men in blue are without Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, Jasprit Bumrah, KL Rahul, and Shreyas Iyer.
In early 2022, India had hammered the Lankan lions by 3-0.
India recently toured New Zealand for three T20Is without senior players, which they won 1-0 after a match was washed off and one ended in a tie.
